oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Hank Thompson Show (XELO) - Series 2, Program 4
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Hank Thompson radio show to promote his songbook on XELO, Ciudad Juárez, Chihuahua, Mexico; advertised as and with a mailing address of Clint, Texas. Labelled as series 2, program 4. Likely original broadcast date of 1950-04-05 (unconfirmed). Backed by his Brazos Valley Boys of Wade Wood on fiddle (mentioned), Lefty Nason on steel guitar (mentioned) and Billy Stewart on bass (presumably, not mentioned).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hank Thompson; Brazos Valley Boys
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Announcer opening statement -- Theme (Humpty Dumpty Heart) -- Yesterday's Mail -- Hank Thompson talks about his songbook -- Beaumont Rag (Wade Wood fiddle) -- A Cat Has Nine Lives -- Afraid -- Announcer talks about the Hank Thompson songbook -- This Is Southland (Lefty Nason steel guitar) -- Have I Told You Lately That I Love You -- Closing statement -- Theme (Humpty Dumpty Heart) -- Announcer talks about the Hank Thompson songbook
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: XELO (Radio station : Ciudad Juárez, Chihuahua, Mexico); Thompson, Hank; Brazos Valley Boys; Nason, Lefty; Wood, Wade; Stewart, Billy (Bassist)
